function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Viruses and bacteria thrive on dry conditions.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Human mucus barrier weakens with low humidity levels.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Increased probability of virus transmission due to high occupant density","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission through surfaces and human-building interactions","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about virus transmission via surfaces and the effectiveness of prevention measures","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation strategies leading to poor air quality","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of common standards and guidelines for evaluating healthy building design, construction, and operation","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of new standards and guidelines","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emergency preparedness guidelines for buildings in extreme events, such as infectious disease pandemics","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cost barrier for real-time ieq measurements","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial arrangements and movement restrictions may lead to crowding and increased transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Potential for virus transmission through ventilation systems and building materials","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of prolonged indoor exposure leading to reduced physical and mental health","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Buildings as a vector for contagious diseases transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of common standards for building design to support health","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of diseases through various sources circulation, respiration/air, human/animal body, water, clothing, surfaces","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission in built environments","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of contact with hands, minimizing contact with door handles and elevator buttons can reduce the risk of contamination specifically for covid-19","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Ventilating/cleaning clothes worn outside, washing hands with soap for a long time, and ventilating spaces are important measures to reduce the risk of covid-19 transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and sunlight in housing structures","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection measures for contaminated items and spaces","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Balconies as areas for observation and leisure activities can lead to close proximity and interaction between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of balconies for daily activities like drying laundry and storing items can potentially spread contaminants or pathogens in the air or on surfaces","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Closure of balconies as a privacy mechanism","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation due to balcony design and configuration","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Inadequate performance evaluation of the balcony space","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and air circulation on the balcony can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning and maintenance of balcony materials may harbor germs and contribute to the spread of diseases.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"High temperature differentials between day and night in the summer","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited rainfall and dry climate in konya","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate balcony spaces considered insufficient for use","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"High percentage of residences with multiple balconies","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of significant difference in regression analysis suggests potential limitations in understanding the impact of demographic factors on health and disease transmission within the built environment.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Significant relationship between balcony size and changes made during the pandemic process suggests that smaller balconies may face challenges in implementing proper disease prevention measures.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential lack of privacy on balconies due to visibility and distance from neighboring balconies and buildings.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of environmental noise and exposure to dust and smoke on balconies.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation on small balconies may limit air circulation and increase the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Lack of sufficient space on balconies may lead to a higher concentration of people in indoor communal areas, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Inadequate quarantine facilities and procedures during 19th-century ottoman empire","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate housing infrastructure for quarantine during covid-19 pandemic","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Temporary and potentially harmful nature of existing cleaning and disinfectant solutions","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of nanotechnology for covid-19 mitigation","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incremental rise in research on antimicrobial graphene compounds","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of graphene oxide go as an effective virucide","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of air filtration systems with graphene for virus killing","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of unproven technology for virus and bacteria elimination on masks and air filtration systems","category":"Air","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on carbon-based materials and composites for antiviral properties","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Requirement of laser treatment and sunlight exposure for reusable graphene-coated face masks","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Use of virucidal chemicals in disinfectant sprays due to their toxicity and adverse effects","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
